intro: Eriosema tisserantii, commonly known as the Tisserant's eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is often found in the succulent Karoo biome, where it contributes to the region's biodiversity. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
